page.title: 19Newby Hall, Bishop Monkton
page.content: Newby Hall is a Wren-style house built in the 1690's,set in 25 acres of magnificent garden on the north bank of the River Ure. It is the home of Mr. & Mrs. Compton, whose family have occupied the house since 1748. The original house was extensively remodelled by local architects in the 18th. century,wings were added and a new entrance constructed. Robert Adam was called in to improve the reception room,including the Sculpture gallery built to house the Roman Sculptures and Gobelin tapestries. The rooms are beautifully decorated to display the priceless furniture including some Chippendale pieces. The hall and gardens are open to the public during the summer.
